en: No matter how old I get, I'll still have the energy to play ping-pong.
ko: 나이를 아무리 먹어도 탁구 칠 기운은 여전할 거야.

en: He will arrive by eight at the latest.
Search as we would, we could not find it.
I haven't got the nerve to ask you for a loan.
ko: 너한테 돈 빌려달라고 할 용기가 안 나.

en: No matter how close we may be, I can not ask him to do that.
ko: 우리가 아무리 친해도 그런 부탁은 못 해.

en: Keep a tally of what you owe.
I don't care how much you say you love me. I know your feelings for her haven't changed.
ko: 나를 아무리 사랑한다고 말해도 소용없어. 그 여자 좋아하는 마음 안 변한 거 다 알거든.

en: No matter how much you might think you like curry, three nights in a row is more than enough.
ko: 네가 아무리 카레를 좋아해도 사흘 연속은 좀 심했지.

en: I've called and called, but there's no answer.
You can't study too hard.
ko: 공부는 아무리 열심히 해도 지나치지 않아.

en: No amount of money will change his mind.
ko: 돈을 아무리 많이 줘도 그 사람 마음은 안 바뀔 거야.

en: However hard he worked, he did not become any better off.
ko: 아무리 열심히 일해도 살림살이가 나아지질 않았어.

en: No matter how hard you may try, you won't succeed so easily.
ko: 아무리 노력해도 그렇게 쉽게 성공하진 못할 거야.

en: We cannot work too hard.
ko: 일은 아무리 열심히 해도 지나치지 않아.

en: Even in the worst case, she will not die of such an illness.
ko: 최악의 경우라도 그런 병으로 죽지는 않을 거야.

en: Try as you may, you will never get him to agree.
ko: 아무리 해봐도 그 사람 찬성 안 할걸.

en: Try as you may, you will find it impossible to give up that habit.
ko: 아무리 노력해도 그 버릇 고치기는 불가능할 거야.

en: Try as we may, we cannot swim to the rock.
ko: 아무리 애써봐도 저 바위까지 헤엄쳐서 못 가.

en: Try as you may, you can't master English in a few months.
ko: 아무리 용을 써도 몇 달 만에 영어를 마스터할 순 없어.

en: What price will you give for this?
However much she eats, she never gains weight.
ko: 걔는 아무리 먹어도 살이 안 찌더라.

en: I always enjoy listening to classical music when I have some free time.
ko: 시간 날 때마다 클래식 음악 듣는 거 좋아해.

en: A number of books were stolen.
I should be glad to be of any service to you.
I would be happy to be of any service to you.
We cannot finish it before Saturday even if everything goes well.
ko: 다 잘 풀린다고 해도 토요일 전까지는 못 끝내.

en: After countless burials of the hatchet, we always dig it up again. There doesn't seem to be any sign of an ever-lasting peace.
ko: 수없이 화해해도 매번 다시 싸우게 돼. 영원한 평화는 없나 봐.

en: No matter the age, a child is a child.
I have some questions to ask, but I don't want to bother you now.
ko: 물어볼 게 좀 있는데 지금 귀찮게 하고 싶진 않아.

en: We ate several, but a good few were left.
ko: 몇 개 먹긴 했는데 꽤 많이 남았어.

en: May I ask some questions?
Please permit me to ask you some questions.
The former is inferior to the latter in some respect.
I don't like her in some ways.
You are wrong in some respects.
I'm not at one with you in some respects.
ko: 몇 가지 점에선 너랑 의견이 달라.

en: He pointed out that the former was inferior to the latter in some respects.
ko: 그는 여러 면에서 전자가 후자보다 못하다고 지적했어.

en: Localities imposed bans on development.
Some fine phrases occurred to the poet.
ko: 시인에게 멋진 문구 몇 개가 떠올랐어.

en: Some species gradually develop elaborate repertoires of dozens or even hundreds of variants of a basic song.
ko: 어떤 종들은 기본 노래를 수십, 수백 가지 변주로 정교하게 발전시켜.

en: Some questions were asked me by the teacher.
ko: 선생님이 나한테 몇 가지 질문을 하셨어.

en: Some poems were also written by him.
ko: 그 사람이 쓴 시도 몇 편 있어.

en: Some difficulties hindered him from doing it.
ko: 몇 가지 어려움 때문에 그 일을 못 하게 됐어.

en: Your writing is good except for a few mistakes.
ko: 오타 몇 개 빼면 잘 썼어.

en: Some families spend their vacation near the beach.
ko: 어떤 가족들은 해변 근처에서 휴가를 보내.

en: Some apples rotted on the tree.
A combination of several mistakes led to the accident.
ko: 몇 가지 실수가 겹쳐서 사고가 났어.

en: Several teams are contending for the prize.
ko: 여러 팀이 우승을 놓고 경쟁하고 있어.

en: Please take some of them.
We have some local wine.
Several scenes have been cut from the original.
The English breakfast was made popular by the architects of the British Empire.
ko: 잉글리시 브렉퍼스트는 대영제국의 주역들 덕분에 유명해졌어요.

en: The British government is against the plan.
ko: 영국 정부는 그 계획에 반대하고 있어요.

en: The English are a polite people.
The English are known for their courtesy.
ko: 영국 사람들은 예의 바른 걸로 유명해요.

en: The English are said to be conservative.
The English are a practical people.
The English set a high value on freedom.
ko: 영국 사람들은 자유를 아주 중요하게 생각해요.

en: England is proud of her poets.
The English are said to be a practical people.
ko: 영국 사람들은 실용적이라는 말을 많이 들어요.

en: The English are a hardy people.
The English love the unicorn as much as they love the lion.
The English entered into the tea trade at that time.

ko: 영국 사람들은 누군가를 소개받을 때 보통 악수를 해요.

en: English people call elevators "lifts".
The English established colonies in America.
The English established colonies in America in 1609.
An Englishman's home is his castle.
An Englishman would act in a different way.
An Englishman would not use such a word.
ko: 영국 사람이라면 그런 단어는 안 썼을 거예요.

en: Compared with the English, we are too near-sighted.
ko: 영국 사람들에 비하면 우린 너무 근시안적이에요.

en: An Englishman would not pronounce it like that.
ko: 영국 사람이라면 그렇게 발음하지 않았을 거예요.

en: There are a lot of expressions used by English people.
ko: 영국 사람들이 쓰는 표현이 참 많아요.

en: Not all English people like fish and chips.
ko: 모든 영국 사람이 피시 앤 칩스를 좋아하는 건 아니에요.

en: The British Parliament is divided into the House of Commons and the House of Lords.
ko: 영국 의회는 하원과 상원으로 나뉘어 있어요.

en: The English Channel separates England and France.
ko: 영국 해협이 영국이랑 프랑스를 갈라놓고 있어요.

en: British English differs from American English in many ways.
ko: 영국 영어는 미국 영어랑 여러 면에서 달라요.

en: There are some differences between British English and American English.
ko: 영국 영어랑 미국 영어 사이에는 몇 가지 차이점이 있어요.

en: Take England for example.
In British English, "to get the sack" means to be fired from your job.
ko: 영국 영어에서 'to get the sack'은 직장에서 해고당한다는 뜻이에요.

en: Britain established many colonies.
England is a land where the policemen carry no revolvers.
ko: 영국은 경찰이 총을 안 들고 다니는 나라예요.

en: England is a country that I've wanted to visit for a long time.
ko: 영국은 제가 오랫동안 가보고 싶어 했던 나라예요.

en: No other English dramatist rivals Shakespeare.
ko: 영국에서 셰익스피어에 비견될 만한 극작가는 없어요.

en: The climate of England is similar to that of Hokkaido.

ko: 영국 축구 팬들은 가끔 통제가 안 될 정도로 난폭해져요.

en: Together with Britain, France may ban imports of waste from Germany.
ko: 영국이랑 같이 프랑스도 독일산 폐기물 수입을 금지할지도 몰라요.

en: While in England I often consulted the guidebook.
ko: 영국에 있는 동안 가이드북을 자주 참고했어요.

en: When I was in England, I had great difficulty trouble in speaking English.
ko: 영국에 있을 때 영어를 하는 데 애를 많이 먹었어요.

en: The fact that Britain had no national anthem before 1745 is in itself of little consequence.
ko: 영국에 1745년 전까지 국가가 없었다는 사실 자체는 별로 중요하지 않아요.

en: British and Japanese cars have steering wheels on the right side.
ko: 영국이랑 일본 차는 운전대가 오른쪽에 있어요.

en: The political systems of Britain and Japan have a great deal in common.
ko: 영국과 일본의 정치 시스템은 공통점이 참 많아요.

en: Who is the greatest poet in England?
I hear the grass is green even in the winter in England.
The weather changes very often in England.
England resembles Japan in many respects.
In England they are supposed to keep to the left.
In England spring really begins with the first of May.
They drive on the left in England.
In Britain they call the subway the underground.
In Britain a truck is referred to as a lorry.
Are the stores closed on Sunday in England?
In England they have much rain at this time of the year.
I come from England.

ko: 예전에는 영국에서 인도까지 배 타고 가는 데 6개월이나 걸렸대요.

en: You can't just come in here and start ordering people around.
ko: 여기 함부로 들어와서 사람들한테 이래라저래라 하면 안 되죠.

en: I was discharged without notice.
Ms Sato is no lightweight. I just saw her chug three bottles of beer.
ko: 사토 씨 보통이 아니에요. 방금 맥주 세 병을 한 번에 비우는 거 봤거든요.

en: Just wandering around can be a good way to travel.
ko: 그냥 발길 닿는 대로 돌아다니는 것도 좋은 여행 방법이에요.

en: Any amount of money will do.
The most careful man sometimes makes mistakes.
ko: 아무리 꼼꼼한 사람이라도 가끔은 실수할 때가 있죠.

en: You can see how much difference a few degrees can make.
ko: 겨우 몇 도 차이가 얼마나 큰지 알 수 있을 거예요.

en: It's surprising how many unhappy marriages there are.
ko: 불행한 결혼 생활을 하는 사람들이 의외로 정말 많아서 놀라워요.

en: No matter how humble it may be, home is home.
ko: 아무리 초라해도 역시 내 집이 최고예요.

en: How to live is the most important thing in life.
How to live is an important question for young people.
ko: 어떻게 살 것인가는 젊은 사람들에게 중요한 문제예요.

en: No matter how learned one may be, he or she cannot be called a good person unless he or she has a sound mind.
ko: 아무리 배운 게 많아도 마음씨가 바르지 않으면 좋은 사람이라고 할 수 없어요.

en: That's Bill all over.
Your clothes say "vacation resort" to me.
ko: 옷차림 보니까 당장 휴양지라도 가야 할 것 같아요.

en: A squid has ten arms.

ko: 세상을 살아가면서 스트레스를 푸는 법을 아는 건 정말 중요해요.

en: You can always count on Holmes in any emergency.
ko: 어떤 비상 상황에서도 홈즈라면 믿을 수 있죠.

en: No animal can exist without plants.
ko: 식물 없이는 어떤 동물도 살 수 없어요.

en: Any virtuous idea can be vicious in itself.

en: No student is allowed to enter the room.
ko: 어떤 학생도 이 방에 들어오면 안 돼요.

ko: 어떤 상황에서도 공주가 왕위를 계승할 일은 없어요.

en: Under no circumstances must you leave the room.
ko: 무슨 일이 있어도 방에서 나가면 안 돼요.

en: No action is in itself good or bad.
ko: 어떤 행동도 그 자체로 선하거나 악하진 않아요.

en: No country should interfere in another country's internal affairs.

It was an adventure going down the river on a raft.
ko: 뗏목을 타고 강을 내려가는 건 정말 모험이었어요.

en: Quit the snow job!
How is it with you?
How do you like Texas so far?
No, thank you. I'm so full.
And Jesus and his disciples had also been invited to the wedding.
Jesus said, "You believe because I told you I saw you under the fig tree."
ko: 예수님께서 "내가 너를 무화과나무 아래서 봤다고 해서 믿느냐?"라고 말씀하셨어요.

en: Jesus answered, "I tell you the truth."
Jesus wept.
Turning around, Jesus saw them following and asked, "What do you want?"
ko: 예수님께서 뒤를 돌아보시고 그들이 따라오는 것을 보며 "무엇을 원하느냐?"라고 물으셨어요.

en: Jesus was born of Mary.
When Jesus saw Nathanael approaching, he said of him, "Here truly is an Israelite in whom there is no deceit."
ko: 예수님께서 나다나엘이 다가오는 것을 보시고 "보라, 저 사람이야말로 참된 이스라엘 사람이다. 그에게는 거짓이 없다"라고 말씀하셨어요.

en: This, the first of the miraculous signs, Jesus performed in Cana in Galilee.
ko: 이것은 예수님께서 갈릴리 가나에서 행하신 첫 번째 표적이었어요.

en: Jesus answered them.
When he saw Jesus passing by, he said...
ko: 그는 예수님께서 지나가시는 걸 보고 이렇게 말했어요...

en: Just say yes or no.
No no she is very naughty.
ko: 아니아니, 걔 진짜 말 안 들어.

en: No, you have to make a connecting flight in Chicago.

ko: 말하는 거랑 행동하는 건 완전 다르지.

en: It goes without saying that honesty is the best policy.
ko: 정직이 최선이라는 건 말할 필요도 없지.

en: I think we could be good friends.
ko: 우리 좋은 친구가 될 수 있을 것 같아.

en: What medicine do you recommend?
Good riddance!
You got that one going in a good direction.
Get yourself a decent suit.
At your age you should know better.
It smells good!
Ah, this hot water's good!
You have a lot of nerve.
He tried harder to get good marks than I did.
ko: 걔는 나보다 점수 잘 받으려고 더 열심히 하더라.

en: It looks as if it's going to be a nice day.
ko: 오늘 날씨 되게 좋을 것 같아.

en: It is a nice day, isn't it?
A nice day, isn't it? How about going for a swim?
Isn't it a lovely day!
It being fine, we went hiking yesterday.
Since the weather is so good, can I open a window?
ko: 날씨도 좋은데 창문 좀 열어도 돼?

en: We have good news.
You got yourself a nice guy.
Hope you'll have a great one.
I think you're on the right track.
You have a nice line in doing your work.
Let's go to the theater early so that we can get good seats.
ko: 좋은 자리 앉게 영화관에 좀 일찍 가자.

en: He seems like quite a find.
He is nice.
He is nice, but he's not the one for me.
ko: 걔 괜찮긴 한데, 내 스타일은 아니야.

en: I'm jealous that you have a good boss.
I'll get you a nice girl.

ko: 난 정말 실력 있는 마술사가 되고 싶어.

en: I hit upon a good idea.
I was dealt a good hand.
Don't you think that's a good combination?
It's not a good car, but it's a car.
ko: 좋은 차는 아니지만, 그래도 차는 차잖아.

en: Did you buy a nice bicycle?
You just take the rough with the smooth.
ko: 살다 보면 좋은 일도 있고 나쁜 일도 있는 거지.

en: If you are a good boy, you shall have a nice cake.
ko: 말 잘 들으면 맛있는 케이크 줄게.

en: Behave yourself, or you'll have to leave the room.
If you are a good girl, you shall have candy.
Don't cry, there's a dear.
Now be a good boy and go beddy-byes.
It seems to be becoming hard to get a good job.
ko: 괜찮은 일자리 구하기가 점점 힘들어지는 것 같아.

en: A good idea came into my mind.
A good idea came into my head.
A good idea entered my mind.
I've got a good idea.
I'm looking forward to good news.
I met him by happy accident.
I'm getting happy.
Like a good wine, he improves with age.
ko: 그 사람은 와인처럼 나이 들수록 더 멋있어져.

en: It seems to be a good house.
Did you have a nice summer?
Isn't it about time you went to bed?
Cut it out.
Open your eyes to reality.
You will make a good wife.
The seasoning is just right.
It sounds great!
He is very bad at inventing excuses.
ko: 걔는 변명 만드는 데 소질 없어.

en: Unless they have a good wine list, I don't want to eat here.
ko: 와인 리스트가 좋지 않으면 여기서 먹기 싫어.

en: Sure, but don't take your time.
Do you know a good restaurant?
Sure. What can I do?
No. He doesn't like water!
No, I can't. I have to watch a baseball game on TV.
ko: 아니, 안 돼. TV로 야구 봐야 해.

en: No, I don't. What's he like?

A good brandy completes a fine meal.
You were lucky to find it.
ko: 그거 찾은 건 진짜 운 좋았네.

en: It was a nice party. You should have come, too.
Sure. Do you know a good place?
Sure. What is it?
Sure. That's a good idea.
Sure. It's next to the Plaza Department Store.
That's great. Nobody gives me anything.
ko: 잘됐네. 난 아무도 아무것도 안 주는데.

en: Let me tell you this. No one succeeded without making an effort.
ko: 하나만 말해줄게. 노력 없이 성공한 사람은 없어.

en: You see, I left school when I was thirteen.
ko: 사실 나 열세 살 때 학교 그만뒀어.

en: Yeast makes dough rise.

ko: 효모는 빵을 부풀게 하는 역할을 해.

en: Yeast makes beer ferment.
Let's go and watch the Easter parade.
Happy Easter!

I learned a lot from what I heard.
I'll tell you a secret.
That's a nice coat.
Did you have a nice Christmas?

I bought a good camera.
Don't do the job just any old way.
Stop pestering me. I'm busy.
Don't give me that!
In other words, he is lazy.
It's a beautiful day, isn't it?
No. I went to Guam once on my honeymoon.
ko: 아니. 신혼여행으로 괌에 한 번 가봤어.

en: No. I have been looking for them for more than one hour.
ko: 아니. 한 시간 넘게 찾고 있어.

en: No, I'm tired.
No, it cannot be true.

That is an old castle.
Isn't that your dictionary?
Those tears are artificial.
They are a good airline to fly with.
Is that a cow or a buffalo?
That was a valuable experience.
That is a leather belt.
That's a problem difficult to solve.
What does that sign say?
What's that bird?
What is the name of that river?
That is not a yellow piece of chalk.
That is a pencil.
Is that the man whose wife was killed in the car accident?
ko: 저 사람이 차 사고로 부인을 잃은 그 사람이야?

en: It's Mt. Rushmore.
It is out of fashion.
That can't be Mary. She is in hospital now.
ko: 저 사람이 메리일 리가 없어. 지금 병원에 있거든.

en: Is that a bus or a car?
Is that a cat?
What a big ship that is!
That is not a tiger.
That is a very complex machine.
It was such a wonderful movie that I saw it five times.
ko: 너무 멋진 영화라서 다섯 번이나 봤어요.

en: That was not at all an appropriate remark.
That is a table.
That is just what I wanted.
Is that as heavy as this?
That is the boy who came here yesterday.
I bet he is our principal.
It's a pheasant.
That is a lovely doll, isn't it?
That is your book.
That is the bus stop.
Yeah, she must be the sure thing!
There is no more difficult task than that.
Can you tell me how this compares to that?
To teach Alex, Pepperberg used a special form of training.
ko: 알렉스를 가르치기 위해 페퍼버그는 특별한 훈련 방식을 사용했어요.

en: How many cars does Alex have?
Alex is for the most part just an ordinary bird.
Alex will answer, "Color!"
Alex seemed to learn nouns such as "paper," "key" and "cork," and color names such as "red," "green" and "yellow."
ko: 알렉스는 "종이", "열쇠", "코르크" 같은 명사와 "빨강", "초록", "노랑" 같은 색깔 이름을 배우는 것 같았어요.

en: "Five!" says Alex.
Alex would correctly describe the object and color, even if he had never seen that object before.
ko: 알렉스는 전에 본 적 없는 물건이라도 물건과 색깔을 정확하게 설명하곤 했어요.

en: Alex names objects, like "walnut," "paper" and "corn".
That amount of food will last them for a week.
ko: 저 정도 양의 음식이면 그들이 일주일은 버틸 거예요.

en: Ask Alex.
How long did it take you to collect so many coins?
ko: 이렇게 많은 동전을 모으는 데 얼마나 걸렸어요?

en: You shouldn't even try making sense of it.
I have taken everything into consideration.
The worried housewife heard the telephone ring and quickly picked up the receiver.
ko: 걱정하던 주부는 전화벨 소리를 듣고 얼른 수화기를 들었어요.

en: Is that a bat?
That was his nearest approach to a smile.
ko: 그게 그가 지을 수 있는 최대한의 미소였어요.

en: That is mine.
That is my school.
That is our baseball field.
That is the house where I have lived for a long time.
ko: 저 집이 제가 오랫동안 살았던 집이에요.

en: That must be the city hall.
That is the poet I met in Paris.
That is the main street of this city.
Isn't that the Golden Gate Bridge?
Oh, I didn't know it was that close.
According to one story, the money was round so that it could roll from place to place.
ko: 한 이야기에 따르면, 돈은 여기저기 굴러다닐 수 있게 둥글게 만들어졌대요.

en: A travel agent arranged everything for our trip.
ko: 여행사 직원이 우리 여행의 모든 걸 준비해 줬어요.

en: One evening a man came to my house.
ko: 어느 날 저녁 한 남자가 우리 집에 왔어요.

en: In a way, life is a cruel thing. It holds major problems in store for each one of us.
ko: 어떤 면에서 인생은 참 잔인해요. 우리 각자에게 큰 시련을 주니까요.

en: Just because a certain book does not interest readers does not mean that the fault lies in the book.
ko: 특정 책이 독자의 흥미를 끌지 못한다고 해서 그게 꼭 책의 잘못인 건 아니에요.

en: I'm working for a trading firm.
I don't think it's easy to form your own opinion on an issue.
ko: 어떤 문제에 대해 자기만의 의견을 갖는 게 쉽지 않은 것 같아요.

en: I'd like to put some things in the hotel safe.
ko: 호텔 금고에 물건을 좀 맡기고 싶어요.

en: I perceived an object looming through the mist.
ko: 안개 속에서 뭔가가 어렴풋이 나타나는 걸 봤어요.

en: You could always hand off some of the work to the junior staff.
ko: 일 좀 밑에 직원들한테 넘겨도 되잖아.

en: A critic once said that if you saw my ballet paintings, you didn't have to go to a live performance.
ko: 한 비평가가 내 발레 그림을 보면 공연에 직접 갈 필요가 없다고 말한 적이 있어.

en: One night he came home very tired and sad.
ko: 어느 날 밤 그가 아주 지치고 슬픈 모습으로 집에 돌아왔어.

en: One night a merchant was walking up the slope on his way home.
ko: 어느 날 밤 한 상인이 집으로 가는 길에 언덕을 올라가고 있었어.

en: One Sunday morning George burst into the living room and said the following.
ko: 어느 일요일 아침 조지가 거실로 뛰어 들어오더니 이렇게 말했어.

en: One day she met a wolf in the woods.
ko: 어느 날 그녀는 숲에서 늑대를 만났어.

en: One day she was spoken to by a stranger.
ko: 어느 날 웬 낯선 사람이 그녀에게 말을 걸었어.

en: One day she and I visited an old friend.
ko: 어느 날 그녀와 나는 오랜 친구를 찾아갔어.

en: One day he set off on a long walk around the town.
ko: 어느 날 그는 마을을 한 바퀴 도는 긴 산책을 나섰어.

en: One day he went to see the doctor.
One day he was walking along the street.
ko: 어느 날 그는 길을 걷고 있었어.

en: It was certain that he saw her there on a certain day.
ko: 그가 어떤 날에 거기서 그녀를 본 건 확실해.

en: One day I visited an old friend.
ko: 어느 날 나는 오랜 친구를 찾아갔어.

en: One day I was lost in London.
One day I visited my aunt.
ko: 어느 날 이모 댁에 놀러 갔어.

en: One day, Natsume Soseki was lost in London.
ko: 어느 날 나쓰메 소세키는 런던에서 길을 잃었어.

en: One day Mike and Jane went downtown to do some shopping.
ko: 어느 날 마이크랑 제인은 쇼핑하러 시내에 나갔어.

en: One day Byron awoke to find himself famous.
ko: 어느 날 바이런은 눈을 떠보니 유명해져 있었어.

en: One day, the police raided a whole group of prostitutes, and the girl was among them.
ko: 어느 날 경찰이 매춘부 일행을 급습했는데, 그 소녀도 그중에 있었어.

en: One day a girl came to visit me.
ko: 어느 날 한 소녀가 나를 찾아왔어.

en: One day an old man went fishing in the river.
ko: 어느 날 한 노인이 강가에 낚시하러 갔어.

en: One day, she told me that she wanted a pet cat.
ko: 어느 날 그녀가 고양이를 키우고 싶다고 나한테 말했어.

en: One day he helped a weak turtle.
ko: 어느 날 그는 힘없는 거북이를 도와줬어.

en: One day he killed himself.
ko: 어느 날 그는 스스로 목숨을 끊었어.

en: One day I met him.
I visited my uncle in the country one day.
ko: 어느 날 시골에 계신 삼촌 댁에 방문했어.

en: One day I was running with my brother.
ko: 어느 날 형이랑 같이 달리고 있었어.

en: One day I found a box there.
ko: 어느 날 거기서 상자 하나를 발견했어.

en: One of the children asked one day: "Where do babies come from?"
ko: 어느 날 아이들 중 한 명이 "아기는 어디서 와요?"라고 물었어.

en: One day, a black woman, Rosa Parks, was returning home after a hard day's work.
ko: 어느 날 흑인 여성 로자 파크스는 고된 하루 일을 마치고 집으로 돌아가던 중이었어.

en: One day, it happened that I passed his house.
ko: 어느 날 우연히 그의 집 앞을 지나게 됐어.

en: One day the men got to his village.
ko: 어느 날 그 남자들이 그의 마을에 도착했어.

en: One day, Chris discovered the charming girl of his dreams.
ko: 어느 날 크리스는 꿈에 그리던 매력적인 여자를 발견했어.

en: One winter morning I met him.
According to one legend, it gets its name from a priest.
ko: 한 전설에 따르면, 어느 신부님의 이름을 따서 지은 거래.

en: I can trust him to a certain extent.
ko: 어느 정도까지는 그를 믿을 수 있어.

en: You are right to a certain extent.
I agree with what you say to some extent.
ko: 네가 하는 말에 어느 정도는 동의해.

en: To some extent I agree with you.
I agree with you to a certain extent.
I trust him to some extent.
In a sense, I can understand his confusion.
ko: 어떤 면에서는 그가 왜 혼란스러워하는지 이해가 돼.

en: You must assimilate into new surroundings.
I agree with you to some extent.
When a currency depreciates, that has an inflationary effect on the economy of the country of the currency.
ko: 통화 가치가 떨어지면 그 나라 경제에 인플레이션 영향을 줘.

en: According to a survey, three in five people today are indifferent to foreign affairs.
ko: 한 조사에 따르면 요즘 사람 다섯 명 중 세 명은 대외 문제에 무관심하대.

en: I awoke one morning and found myself famous.
ko: 어느 날 아침에 일어나 보니 내가 유명해져 있었어.

en: I awoke one morning to find myself famous.
ko: 어느 날 아침에 눈을 떴더니 내가 유명해져 있더라고.

en: One morning he went for a walk.
ko: 어느 날 아침 그는 산책을 나갔어.

en: It happened one morning that she met him on the street.
ko: 어느 날 아침 우연히 길에서 그를 만났어.

en: One morning he saw a pretty girl.
ko: 어느 날 아침 그가 예쁜 여자를 봤어요.

en: One morning at breakfast we children were informed to our utter dismay that we could no longer be permitted to run absolutely wild.
ko: 어느 날 아침 식사 때 우리 아이들은 더 이상 마음대로 뛰어놀 수 없다는 말을 듣고 정말 큰 충격에 빠졌어요.

en: You shall judge of a man by his foes as well as by his friends.
ko: 친구뿐만 아니라 적을 보고도 그 사람을 판단할 수 있어요.

en: A man was complaining of something in a sharp voice.
ko: 어떤 남자가 날카로운 목소리로 무언가 불평하고 있었어요.

en: If you watch the sun setting on a warm, damp day, you can see the moisture changing the shape of the sun.
ko: 따뜻하고 습한 날에 해가 지는 걸 보면 습기 때문에 해 모양이 변하는 걸 볼 수 있어요.

en: A group started a campaign to preserve rain forests.
ko: 한 단체가 열대우림을 보호하기 위한 캠페인을 시작했어요.

en: If you want to know how a certain word is used, look it up in this dictionary.
ko: 어떤 단어가 어떻게 쓰이는지 알고 싶으면 이 사전을 찾아보세요.

en: There lived an old man in a village.
ko: 한 마을에 어떤 할아버지가 살고 있었어요.

en: A math teacher says, "With a calculator, the child can reach the right answer, but have no idea at all how he got there."
ko: 한 수학 선생님이 "계산기가 있으면 아이가 답은 맞힐 수 있지만, 어떻게 그 답이 나왔는지는 전혀 모르게 돼요"라고 말했어요.

en: It is very hard to tell what country a person comes from.
ko: 그 사람이 어느 나라 사람인지 알아맞히는 건 정말 어려워요.

en: What makes one person more intelligent than another?
ko: 무엇이 사람을 다른 사람보다 더 똑똑하게 만들까요?

en: Some people seemed to think the good times were going to last forever.
ko: 어떤 사람들은 좋은 시절이 영원히 계속될 거라고 생각하는 것 같았어요.

en: One went fishing, another went shopping.
ko: 한 명은 낚시하러 가고, 다른 한 명은 쇼핑하러 갔어요.

en: What makes one person a genius and another person a fool?
ko: 무엇이 한 사람은 천재로, 다른 사람은 바보로 만들까요?

en: One man says this, another that.
ko: 어떤 사람은 이렇게 말하고, 다른 사람은 저렇게 말해요.

en: One man's meat is another man's poison.
ko: 누구에게는 약인 게 다른 누구에게는 독이 될 수도 있어요.

en: One man was seen digging with his bare hands.
ko: 어떤 남자가 맨손으로 땅을 파고 있는 모습이 보였어요.

en: The fact that a man lives on the same street with me does not mean he is my friend.
ko: 그 사람이 저와 같은 거리에 산다고 해서 제 친구라는 뜻은 아니에요.

en: A man came to see me yesterday.
It is not good manners to laugh at someone when he makes mistakes.
ko: 남이 실수했을 때 비웃는 건 예의가 아니에요.

en: It is not too much to say that a man's interests are a sure guide to the real man.
ko: 관심사를 보면 그 사람이 어떤 사람인지 알 수 있다고 해도 과언이 아니에요.

en: A certain girl was a prostitute but didn't want her grandma to know.
ko: 어떤 여자가 성매매 일을 하고 있었는데 할머니가 그 사실을 모르길 바랐어요.

en: A woman lost her driver's license while she was shopping the other day at a department store.
ko: 요전날 어떤 여자가 백화점에서 쇼핑하다가 운전면허증을 잃어버렸어요.

en: A woman was hurt in the accident, and her two daughters were too.
ko: 그 사고로 어떤 여자분이 다쳤고, 그분의 두 딸도 다쳤어요.

en: A woman brought an old picture of her dead husband, wearing a hat, to the photographer.
ko: 한 여자가 모자를 쓴 죽은 남편의 옛날 사진을 사진관에 가져갔어요.

en: A girl phoned me.
A woman was sitting on a stool in a bar.
ko: 어떤 여자가 바의 의자에 앉아 있었어요.

en: One hot summer afternoon she decided to take her boyfriend to a farm outside the town.
ko: 어느 더운 여름날 오후에 그녀는 남자친구를 시외에 있는 농장에 데려가기로 했어요.

en: One hot summer afternoon, John and Dan were cutting the long grass.
ko: 어느 더운 여름날 오후, 존과 댄은 길게 자란 풀을 베고 있었어요.

en: They were erected to commemorate a certain event or to tell an ancestral legend.
ko: 그것들은 특정 사건을 기념하거나 조상의 전설을 전하기 위해 세워졌어요.

en: If a tree dies, plant another in its place.
ko: 나무가 죽으면 그 자리에 다른 나무를 심으세요.

en: Certain poisons, properly used, are useful.
Some animals can sense the coming of a storm.
ko: 어떤 동물들은 폭풍이 오는 걸 감지할 수 있어요.

en: Certain animals are fast disappearing.
Some kinds of birds can't fly.
We can conjecture that it may be advantageous for a particular bird to be known to its neighbors or its mate.
ko: 특정 새가 이웃이나 짝에게 알려지는 게 유리할 수도 있다고 추측해 볼 수 있어요.

en: Some kinds of food make one thirsty.
The prices of certain foods vary from week to week.
Some plants cannot adapt themselves to the cold.
That kind of behavior is characteristic of the boy.
In one letter he remarks, "Life is but a dream".
ko: 한 편지에서 그는 "인생은 꿈일 뿐이다"라고 말했어요.

en: What is right in one society can be wrong in another.
ko: 한 사회에서 맞는 것이 다른 사회에서는 틀릴 수도 있어요.

en: I got hurt during an experiment, and the injury was pretty serious.
There have always been fashionable faces and expressions which marked an epoch.
ko: 어느 시대에나 그 시대를 대표하는 유행하는 얼굴과 표정이 있었어요.

en: The museums are full of objects which the most cultivated taste of a period considered beautiful, but which seem to us now worthless.
ko: 박물관에는 당시의 가장 세련된 안목으로 아름답다고 여겨졌던 물건들이 가득하지만, 지금 우리에게는 아무 가치도 없어 보이는 것들이 많아요.

en: The best way to know what a country is like is to go and see it with your own eyes.
ko: 어떤 나라인지 알 수 있는 가장 좋은 방법은 직접 가서 보는 거예요.

en: If you are to know a nation, you must learn its history.
ko: 한 나라를 제대로 알기 위해서는 그 나라의 역사를 배워야 해요.

en: When I first visit a country, I always try to share a meal with the people there.
ko: 어떤 나라에 처음 가면 저는 항상 현지 사람들과 식사를 같이 하려고 해요.

en: The manners and customs of a country reflect its culture.
ko: 한 나라의 관습과 풍습은 그 나라의 문화를 반영해요.

en: As soon as one airline announced its plan for airfare reductions, the rest of the companies followed suit.
ko: 한 항공사가 요금을 내리겠다고 발표하자마자 나머지 항공사들도 따라 내렸어요.

en: An idea came to me.
A certain door-to-door salesman made a fool of a trusting old lady and went off with a lot of her money.
ko: 어떤 방문 판매원이 사람을 잘 믿는 할머니를 속여서 돈을 몽땅 가로채 갔대.

en: There lived a king in an old castle.
ko: 오래된 성에 어떤 왕이 살고 있었어.

en: A study reports that 53,000 Americans die each year as a result of secondhand smoke.
ko: 한 연구에 따르면 매년 미국인 5만 3천 명이 간접흡연 때문에 죽는대.

en: According to a study, big women are more prone to have twins.
ko: 한 연구 결과에 따르면 몸집이 큰 여자들이 쌍둥이를 낳을 확률이 더 높대.

en: A study shows lung cancer accounts for 17% of women's cancer deaths.
ko: 한 연구 결과에 의하면 폐암이 여성 암 사망 원인의 17%를 차지한대.

en: One professor says that even if Alex is using words, it's wrong to call it a language.
ko: 한 교수는 알렉스가 단어를 쓴다고 해도 그걸 언어라고 부르는 건 틀린 거래.

en: A generous man contributed some two billion yen to charity.
ko: 어떤 마음씨 좋은 사람이 자선 단체에 20억 엔 정도를 기부했어.

en: A strange idea sprang up in my mind.
I'm going to see some student.
ko: 어떤 학생 좀 만나러 갈 거야.

en: A scholar made an excellent speech about human rights.
